original_text:
**INSTITUTION
GENERAL MEDICINE
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY]
**NAME[ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[May 18 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[May 25 2007]
PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS :
Anxiety .
SECONDARY DIAGNOSES :
Urinary tract infection with hypotension with prerenal azotemia .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient is a pleasant **AGE[in 80s]- year - old elderly woman who was admitted with hypotension , urosepsis , and prerenal azotemia .
She was managed with intravenous fluids , oral trimethoprim and sulfamethoxazole in the hospital .
In view of premorbid anxiety , Psychiatry opinion was obtained .
It was decided to start her on Seroquel 12.5 p.o. q.6 h. p.r.n. along with daily dose of Lexapro for underlying depression .
The patient has had prior reactions to alprazolam with paradoxical stimulant effect with worsening delirium in the past .
It is not clear at this moment of time whether these reactions were secondary to the nature of the drug or due to underlying urine infection .
DISHCARGE RECOMMENDATIONS :
Clinical examination on discharge is stable .
The patient has been given followup with **INSTITUTION in **DATE[Jun 2007] .
She has had a clinical work and differential which included mild cognitive impairment versus early dementia with underlying depression and prominent anxiety in the hospital .
She is currently on Lexapro and oral Seroquel .
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY :
Hypertension , anxiety , depression , hypothyroidism , dyslipidemia , history of urinary tract infection , left nasolacrimal duct obstruction with tentative mass in lacrimal sac status post dacryocystorhinostomy operation .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
Current medications at discharge :
1. Atenolol 25 mg p.o. daily .
2. Simvastatin 20 mg p.o. daily .
3. Levothyroxine 25 mcg p.o. daily .
4. Lexapro 10 mg p.o. daily .
5. Clonazepam 0.25 mg p.o. q.6 h. p.r.n.
6. Losartan 50 mg p.o. daily .
7. Quetiapine 12.5 mg p.o. q.6 p.r.n.
8. Bactrim 1 tablet p.o. b.i.d.
9. Cephalexin 250 mg p.o. q.6 h. for 7 days .
The patient had a left lacrimal sac mass , underwent dacryocystorhinostomy and DCR operation performed by Oculoplastic and has a follow up with Oculoplastic Surgery for lacrimal sac mass .
Surgery was done by Dr. **NAME[XXX WWW] .
No further recommendations .
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY]
**NAME[ZZZ]
Dictator :
**NAME[YYY ZZZ] , M.D.
AN/s
D :
**DATE[May 25 2007] 15:34:06
T :
**DATE[May 25 2007] 23:07:36
R :
**DATE[May 25 2007] 23:07:36/s
Job ID :
361715/**ID-NUM
Cc:
**NAME[XXX CCC WWW] , M.D.
The patient 's primary physician .
**INSTITUTION
<start footer>
<END FOOTER>
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[ZZZ , VVV] ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ]
**DATE[May 28 2007] 10:13:55 PM
